Text: I went ahead and entered ya.
So be grateful!
Be super grateful!!!
Huh?

We wanted to enter, too, but we're just too banged
up, so...
Um, I'm not doing it.

Why not?! Flex your skills at the tourney, and you'll
be able to pull two or three girls eas—
—Ierrrgh!
And if you get a couple extra, you can send 'em ou—
—Rrrrgh!
Alluva sudden my stomach's killin' me...
M-Mine too...
Food poisoning, huh? Gotta watch out for that stuff.
Sigh...
A tournament, huh?

That evening, just as the students start thinning out
and I am passing through the garden, a girl suddenly
approaches me.

She wears the uniform of a second-year student at the
science academy and has her dark brown hair in a bun.
Her eyes, framed by a pair of unfashionable glasses, are
the same color.

(But as someone with more experience, she can't fool
me so easily—this is a beauty hiding in plain sight by
pretending to be a side character.)
Hey, can I talk to you for a sec?
I know her voice from somewhere.

She nods as I whisper her name. Even a classy, adult
woman can change with some glasses, makeup, and
a different hairdo.
I continue to speak in a hushed voice.
You go to the academy?

No, I'm just borrowing these. I'll stand out less if
I dress the part.
Gotcha.

Unfamiliar faces are more common than familiar ones
here at the Academy. As long as you have a uniform
on, no one is likely to question your presence.

There is no one near the benches offering a view of
the beautiful garden. So we go to sit there under the
faint glow of the evening sun.
I sigh as I read the paper in my hand.

(I'm participating in the Bushin Festival qualifiers,
huh...)

The Bushin Festival is held once every two years. It's
a big deal and brings in famed knights from other
lands.

And since the festival is organized by the Academy,
this invitational will determine the bracket.

(As someone trying to keep a low profile, I had no
intention of drawing attention to myself by
appearing in such a thing, but...)

Regarding the black-clad man we captured yesterday...
As expected, his mind was shattered due to powerful
brainwashing.
Hmm.

This is something we see in all the Third Children,
the vanguard of the Cult of Diablos.

Unfortunately, we were unable to extract any
information from him, no matter what method
we used.
Wow.

Children of Diablos are created by subjecting orphans
and impoverished youths with magical aptitude to a
barrage of chemicals and brainwashing.

It's a technique the Cult has been using
for many years.

Their goal is likely to draw us out by assuming the
Shadow Garden name.
How dare they...
Well, I won't take the bait.

Understood, my lord. However, I should add that we
have recently confirmed the presence of a Named
First Child in the city.
It is Rex, the Game of Betrayal.
Named...?

Yes. The First retain their sense of self, despite
their status as Children…

What's more, the presence of a Named in the capital
clearly indicates that the Cult has some further
objective.

...I see. If it can shed light on their ultimate goal,
we can find ways of exploiting even the most
carefully set stage.
Master Shadow?
This is a good opportunity.

A good opportunity? You mean to turn their own plans
against them?
I've already laid the groundwork to do just that...
Although I suppose it'll need a little polishing.
See you later, Nu.

So I've got 24 now... I'd like to have at least
twice that many...

He immediately finds the best solution in any
situation... No, he already knows it from the
very beginning.

That must be his Shadow Wisdom...
It's so far beyond me.

Looking down on the academy garden, Nu squints
through her glasses.

Academy life... If only everything was as it
was supposed to be...

If everything had gone as it should have, she would
have been attending this very academy as a second-
year student.

Until the day she was cast out as one of the
possessed, Nu had never once doubted that
a peaceful, pleasant future lay ahead of her.
But in the end, it was all an illusion.

Family, friends, peace, and everything else she was
so sure of and never questioned turned out to be a
tower built upon the thinnest of ice...

And herself, a child frolicking about, completely
oblivious to the idea that there could be danger
below the surface.

Nu was the daughter of a marquis family and thus
spent her days living in splendor.
But that was a long time ago.

It's questionable how many of her once-dear friends
even remember her now.

They might say, "Oh yeah, I kinda remember her."
At most, she probably only comes up in rumors
spoken more with scorn than with affection.
That's just how possession goes.

Nu watches the students passing through the garden
with eyes filled with a mix of envy and pity.

If meeting Shadow were her only purpose, there
would be no reason to go through the trouble of
visiting the academy during the day.

However, Nu hasn't fully given up hope. Hope that,
in some corner in this idyllic academy, a place
for her still exists.
She wants to have that foolish dream.
Nu laughs.
But rather than living in ignorance of the truth...
I much prefer the life I have now.
